projects.name: Envoy
projects.description: Designed and developed Envoy (a Mac OS-native proprietary asset tracking system) as a replacement for legacy tools to audit and manage 1000+ client computers. Envoy provides regular resource utilization reports; lets users submit support requests; integrates with DeepTech's remote access software; keeps itself up-to-date; and can be remotely reconfigured or uninstalled.

projects.name: Technical service and support
projects.description: Serves on DeepTech's Macintosh and network support team. Handles client questions over the phone, via remote access, and on site. Participates in technology infrastructure design and wiring for clients moving to new spaces.

projects.name: Front-end web development
projects.description: Worked with the existing web team to develop a WebKit-optimized JavaScript UI library for DeepTech's technician portal, using jQuery extensively along with a small set of jQuery plugins. Controlled by an HTML API.

projects.name: Lasso CalDAV interface
projects.description: Built a minimal CalDAV client in Lasso with APIs to add, edit, and remove events and watch for changes to events by other clients.

projects.name: Reverse engineering
projects.description: Reconstructed a hash algorithm from an x86 executable.

projects.name: Forensics
projects.description: Worked with the NYPD to recover data contributing to a criminal investigation.

projects.name: Debugging
projects.description: Reduce and report bugs in third-party software on a regular basis. Credited for security issues in Mac OS (fixed in [Security Update 2010-002 / Mac OS X v10.6.3](http://support.apple.com/kb/ht4077)) and iOS (fixed in [4.0](http://support.apple.com/kb/ht4225)). Credited for non-security issue in cURL (fixed in [7.21.1](http://curl.haxx.se/mail/lib-2010-08/0146.html)).

projects.name: Snap Autocomplete
projects.description: Built a caching JavaScript autocomplete engine for Worcester Polytechnic Institute's [SNAP](http://www.wpi.edu/Admin/Police/Safety/snap.html).

projects.name: FIRST Robotics Team 555, Montclair High School, New Jersey
projects.description: Lead programmer (2005-2007). Built competition robots which won regional championships and earned awards at the regional and international levels, including a regional Innovation in Control award for my programming using machine vision.
